metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4450 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The HTTP server in Node.js 0.10.x before 0.10.21 and 0.8.x before 0.8.26allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory and CPUconsumption) by sending a large number of pipelined requests withoutreading the response.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4450` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nodejs - 0.10.25~dfsg2-2ubuntu1
nodejs-legacy - 0.10.25~dfsg2-2ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nodejs package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.10.25~dfsg2-2ubuntu1').
